hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io

Class SerialUSB

  • java.lang.Object
    • hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io.SerialUSB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, IOType, EventListener

    public final class SerialUSB
extends Object
implements gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, IOType
    SerialUSB serializes the strings given by the vector and writes them to the usb interface. For a proper function the class needs a ComPort object which can be retrieved using a ComPortHandler.

    The SerialUSB object is used by ComHandler in order to start the command execution process.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SerialUSB(ComPort selPort)
      Creates a new SerialUSB object based on a given communication port (object of class ComPort).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialUSB

        public SerialUSB(ComPort selPort)
        Creates a new SerialUSB object based on a given communication port (object of class ComPort). Available ComPort objects are provided through class ComPortHandler.
        Parameters:
        selPort - the selected communication port.
        See Also:
        ComPort, ComPortHandler, ComHandler

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public boolean write(Vector<String> data)
        Writes data to the selected serial communication port.
        Specified by:
        write in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector that contains the output data in a string format.
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • read

        public boolean read(Vector<String> data)
        Reads data from the specified serial communication port. The data is provided by the Vector object given as an input parameter.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector that contains the input data in a string format.
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the specified serial communication port. Closing a previously closed communication port has no effect. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IOType
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise.
        See Also:
        Status

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(gnu.io.SerialPortEvent serialPortEvent)
        Implementation of interface SerialPortEventListener. The listener is called in case of new input data.

        In this version there is no implementation here.
        Specified by:
        serialEvent in interface gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
        Parameters:
        serialPortEvent - Event of type SerialPortEvent
